chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
